author: Chloe P.
text: Really not about the whole getting dressed and leaving bed thing today

author: Chloe P.
text: Just a reminder that HIV is not a “gay disease” and that in this time of great need for blood donors, we must revisit our discriminatory eligibility criterion. https://t.co/7RhKA6aMOq

author: Chloe P.
text: I’m so glad my depression is getting under control so I can really FEEL the anxiety that was hiding underneath !!

author: Chloe P.
text: Thinking back to when they told us masks weren’t effective because they didn’t have enough to go around… https://t.co/rUORj6qQsw

author: Chloe P.
text:
@GovCanHealth  and @sante_qc  Yall should also be addressing this. 
Signed, a fed up uterus owner.

author: Chloe P.
text:
Hey @moderna_tx this is the second time your COVID-19 vaccine has set off unexpected menstruation for me. Could we not warn people about this potential side effect?
#moderna #ModernaBooster #womenshealth

author: Chloe P.
text:
As a person without a family doctor who can't access mental health care, this curfew is much more likely to kill me than the virus is. @francoislegault 
Help us. We've made far more sacrifice than any of us were capable of. Stop bleeding quebecers dry.

author: Chloe P.
text: Just watched Dont Look Up and it reminded me of how little faith I have in humanity 🥰

author: Chloe P.
text: Litterally planning my escape from quebec as we speak…

author: Chloe P.
text: Quebec has already waited way too long to acknowledge, address and treat the mental health crisis it’s measures are having on its people (especially the young adults and the elderly). We need easier access to mental health professionals NOW, especially if we’re re-confining. SOS!

author: Chloe P.
text: My current dream is to buy some land and a big house in the middle of nowhere where all my friends and I can go escape the real world until it becomes bearable again.

author: Chloe P.
text:
“It’s the anxiety telling you that” “That’s the depression speaking” 

No its current affairs. So many youth have lived their entire adult lives in a pandemic. Our hopelessness comes from the reality we experience.

author: Chloe P.
text:
I am genuinely so appalled at this. And to say this is my home town… Our community is so shaken and desperate to find a way to contest this. Islamophobia has no place in our schools. 

https://t.co/41C8F6mNkR

author: Chloe P.
text:
Had the amazing opportunity to be published by the CBC?! About the condition of young low wage workers since COVID-19 hit Canada. #workingclass #youthemployment #canada #canadianyouth

https://t.co/sYNjElit1b
